intro: Erophila verna var. affinis, commonly known as the early sorrel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes other plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. It features distinctive heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
